elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the income statement.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What does an income statement show?
elements.correctAnswer: The income statement compares the expenses and income of an accounting period (usually one year).

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What can you see from an income statement?
elements.correctAnswer: The income statement shows what funds have been used for and what funds have been earned. The comparison results in a positive or negative difference, which shows the profit or loss.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What do the terms "cost of goods sold" and "revenue from goods sold" mean? Explain both in one sentence each.
elements.correctAnswer: The cost of goods sold is the amount that a company has paid for the purchase of its goods. Revenue from goods is the amount that a company has earned from the sale of its goods.
